main event: An unidentified flying object was observed by a technical engineer in Charlottesville, Virginia on December 31, 1952. The object was described as a brightly lighted, disk-shaped object that hovered and moved in a zig-zag fashion.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 35 to 50 feet in diameter and emitted a bluish-white light., The sighting lasted approximately 30 seconds., The observer has extensive experience in commercial aviation., The object moved off at high speed in a zig-zag pattern, resembling a ball of fire., The reports suggest multiple witnesses to the sighting, adding credibility.
witness description: Technical Engineer with extensive experience in commercial aviation.
